title: SOLD - 1899-00 M101-1 Sporting News Supplement - FRED CLARKE - HOF Rookie
author: h2oya311

posts.post_title: SOLD - 1899-00 M101-1 Sporting News Supplement - FRED CLARKE - HOF Rookie
posts.post_content:
Up for sale is the following 1899-00 M101-1 Sporting News Supplement of Fred Clarke with Louisville.  [S]$XXX[/S] $SOLD

First to email me at [url]h2oya311@yahoo.com[/url] with an "I'll take it" will be the new owner.  Paypal f/f preferred.

Thanks for looking!
Derek

edited to add the following:
It looks like there is some sort of mark on the left part of the Supplement.  It does not appear to be a pencil marking, but does look more like some sort of scratch from a metal object rubbing against it.  Someone did write "230" on the back in pencil.  Updated scans have been posted below

[IMG]http://photos.imageevent.com/derekgranger/derekgrangerfirstalbum/websize/1899%20Clarke1.jpg[/IMG][IMG]http://photos.imageevent.com/derekgranger/derekgrangerfirstalbum/websize/1899%20Clarke%20_back_1.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]http://photos.imageevent.com/derekgranger/derekgrangerfirstalbum/websize/1899%20Clarke%20_close-up2_1.jpg[/IMG]
Great looking piece! Is this considered Clarkes "true" rookie?

Bump for improved pictures and more detail.

And Bruinsfan, I always believed this to be Clarke's rookie issue, although some would argue it doesn't qualify due to its larger size and paper stock (vs. cardboard stock).  I always believed it to be Clarke's earliest collectible until I came across a pretty cool Cabinet card of his from 1898, which is now in my collection.

That said, the M101-1 is still listed on the oldcardboard.com website as the earliest collectible of Mr. Clarke.
